greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Starting with m = 1, p = 2 and x = n, iterate m -> m * p^valuation(x,p), x -> floor(x/p), p -> {the next prime after p}, until x is zero. Then a(n) = product of the values of m and p that were reached at the end of the iteration.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..32768
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: (PARI) A328613(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= p^valuation(n,p); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m*p); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 22 2019
